About.name: Edge Hill University
About.about:
At Edge Hill University, we’ve been inspiring minds and changing futures since 1885. We help students embark on inspirational journeys, expanding their knowledge and creating lifelong friendships. Whatever you study, we invest in your future and provide you with the tools you need to succeed.
Located in Lancashire, close to Liverpool and Manchester, we’ve created a diverse environment where our students can live, learn, and belong—recognised in the Complete University Guide as a Top 4 University in the North West (2025).
Lecture halls are equipped with everything you need, and our high-quality teaching brings subjects to life. If you're moving away for the first time, our on-campus accommodation provides a home away from home within easy reach of study and social spaces - ranked 1st in the UK by students (Uni Compare, 2025).
Recently rated an Ofsted 'Outstanding' provider, you'll be taught by research-active staff who are experts in their field, ensuring you reach your full potential.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
What makes us different is our purpose. For us, our purpose has always been about much more than education. It’s about creating access to knowledge, because we know out of knowledge comes opportunity.  The kind of opportunity that opens doors to change, empowering you to imagine a different future. Not just for yourself, but for wider society too.
A future in which you can go out into the world sharing new ideas with energy and integrity to inspire those around you and make a difference. That’s why we challenge ourselves to deliver the highest quality teaching and learning resources. Expanding knowledge through exceptional research and scholarship opportunities to enhance lives and unlock potential. So when you’ve graduated with us you won’t just go on to do great things. You’ll go on to inspire others.

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: Friends for life. Life lessons. Finding your passions. Finding yourself. We know what student life is all about. And it’s the people around you who help make the experience one you’ll never forget. That’s why there’s always something happening on campus. From sport competitions to film screenings, live theatre to society socials.

Get out your comfort zone and try something new. Find friends with the same interests as you through our Students’ Union or meet others who share your voice for the greater good. Our on-campus bar and nightclub is also a great place to catch up with friends and make new ones, or you can venture into Ormskirk town centre or catch a train to Liverpool to soak up its culture and nightlife.

As a University for everyone, it won’t take you long to find your place. We’re proud of nurturing a community where people feel safe to be themselves. An environment that celebrates diversity, inclusivity and equality. Where you can be you.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in North West?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: The North West is made up of Cheshire, Cumbria, Greater Manchester, Lancashire, and Merseyside. Its two biggest cities, Liverpool and Manchester, are global landmarks in music and football history.

The region was the heart of the industrial revolution – at one time, Lancashire produced half the world’s cotton. Many architectural reminders of this era remain, like Liverpool’s Royal Albert Docks and Chester's Victorian centre.
The stunning Lake District – home to England’s highest peak, Scafell Pike – needs no filters, while Blackpool is a seaside adventure.

campusParagraphs: Look around our 160-acre campus and you’ll soon see why it’s award-winning. We’ve invested more than £350m over the last decade to create a space that’s not just a great place to live, study and socialise but is inspiring to be around.

With everything in one place, you’ll never be far from where you need to be. Having over 2,000 halls of residence rooms on campus means you can walk to your lectures, the library, the Sports Centre, the SU, our cafes, beach and social spaces, or access support services within minutes. And when you do need to leave campus, Ormskirk town centre is just a 10-minute walk away, or free shuttle bus journey. Our central North West location means major cities and natural beauty spots can be found on your doorstep too.

So if you’re moving away from home for the first time, there’s no better place to be. Feel independent but safe living at the heart of our stunning campus with rooms to fit every need and budget, guaranteed to first-year undergraduates.

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: Dedicated to high-quality teaching, every building, every space and every course is geared towards helping you get the most out of your studies and developing the knowledge and skills employers want. Whether you want to create, simulate real scenarios, perform or experiment, our specialist facilities let you do just that. Facilities include the Clinical Skills and Simulation Centre, professional media studios, 3D CAVE, biology and geography labs, and a mock courtroom. That’s why we’re 2nd in the North West for Learning Resources (NSS, 2021).

We offer various foundation degrees, single and joint honours degrees and integrated Masters courses across a range of disciplines. All are future-focused offering work placements, sandwich years or study abroad opportunities, giving you the chance to apply what you’ve learned in the real world.  Many courses are accredited by professional bodies so you’ll be ready to meet the challenges that businesses and society are facing once you graduate.

International.heading: International
paragraphs: Edge Hill University hosts a diverse community of aspirational and inspirational students from across the world. You will be joining a top 10 modern University (The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2020) where you will be taught and supported by staff with extensive links within their disciplines and leading subject knowledge. With our generous scholarships available to all international students, Edge Hill University provides an excellent student and academic experience at an affordable price
About the University

Edge Hill University is based on an attractive, award-winning 160-acre campus in Lancashire, close to Liverpool and Manchester. The institution has been providing higher education since 1885, with a mission to create opportunity from knowledge.

The institution’s significant success in achieving its mission is recognised by a range of awards and high rankings for teaching, student experience, accommodation and more. Edge Hill is ranked as Gold in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF), the government’s evaluation of excellence in teaching quality, learning environment and student outcomes. The University is also one of the select few to have held the coveted UK University of the Year title, awarded by Times Higher Education (2014/15).
Life in the North West

Voted in the top 15 universities in the UK for local life (WhatUni Student Choice Awards 2020), Edge Hill is situated in the heart of the North West of England, close to the thriving market town of Ormskirk and the vibrant cities of Liverpool and Manchester.

Ormskirk is ideally situated for exploring the rest of the UK. Whether you are looking for countryside or city life as your next destination, many locations are easily accessible within 1-2 hours, giving you plenty of opportunities for weekend visits.

StudentSupport.heading: Student support
paragraphs: There’s plenty of support and wellbeing available to you at Edge Hill University. We’re here to support your journey into higher education. We’ll also be there to support you during and after your studies to make sure you get the most out of university.
No matter what your background is, we are here to support you. You can find out more about the specific support available below, or by visiting our website.
Pre-entry support
Health and wellbeing support
Careers service
Money advice
Accommodation support
Inclusion support
Social support
Read more on our website about our dedicated support for:
Disabled students
Mature students
Care experienced and estranged students (CEES)
Black, Asian, minority ethnic students
